template.description:
Use horizontal bar charts when you want to show comparisons of quantity. Examples include population by city, touchdowns by player or sales by vehicle model.

As a general rule, horizontal bar charts should not be used to show trends over time, for example, how many homes are purchased each year. Use a line chart instead.

Your data should contain two columns:

* One with the categorical labels, like "Dallas", "Philadelphia", "Los Angeles", etc.
* And another that contains the numeric values that will determine the width of the bars.
template.title: Horizontal bar chart

text.author: Jane Doe / POLITICO
